citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
One male red puppy from Jazmine's Bichipoo litter born 9-November-2023 has an abnormal condition of the rear left leg.
The leg is held out to the side and the inspector can feel hard swellings in upper leg bone and lower leg bones suggestive
of an old injury to the bones. The puppy walks with a severe limp and put no pressure on the leg. The licensee states they
called a licensed veterinarian on 30-November-2023 and was instructed to wrap the leg for 5 days. The leg was wrapped
for 5 days but no additional veterinary care was provided. The licensee did not contact the veterinarian again. An
untreated leg injury could cause pain and discomfort to the puppy and if left untreated could lead to further health issues.
French Bulldog MC#933000320591069 was received by the licensee approximately two weeks ago limping on the rear
right leg. The dog does put a little weight on the leg but holds the leg up when walking. This dog was reluctant to move
around her enclosure. The licensee has not provided any veterinary treatment or contacted the veterinarian regarding this
dog's condition. Lameness or limping may be sign of pain or distress and if not treated could lead to further health issues.
The licensee must use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. Both dogs
must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop on effective treatment plan. This
documentation should be available for APHIS inspection.
To be corrected by: End of Business 23-December-2023
A complete routine inspection was conducted on 21-December-2023. This inspection report is limited to the Direct non-
compliances identified during that inspection. An additional inspection report will be delivered with the other non-
compliances identified during this inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
One male red puppy from Jazmine's Bichipoo litter born 9-November-2023 has an abnormal condition of the rear left leg. 
The leg is held out to the side and the inspector can feel hard swellings in upper leg bone and lower leg bones suggestive 
of an old injury to the bones. The puppy walks with a severe limp and put no pressure on the leg. The licensee states they 
called a licensed veterinarian on 30-November-2023 and was instructed to wrap the leg for 5 days. The leg was wrapped 
for 5 days but no additional veterinary care was provided. The licensee did not contact the veterinarian again. An 
untreated leg injury could cause pain and discomfort to the puppy and if left untreated could lead to further health issues. 
 
French Bulldog MC#933000320591069 was received by the licensee approximately two weeks ago limping on the rear 
right leg. The dog does put a little weight on the leg but holds the leg up when walking. This dog was reluctant to move 
around her enclosure. The licensee has not provided any veterinary treatment or contacted the veterinarian regarding this 
dog's condition. Lameness or limping may be sign of pain or distress and if not treated could lead to further health issues. 
 
The licensee must use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. Both dogs 
must be evaluated by a licensed veterinarian for an accurate diagnosis and to develop on effective treatment plan. This 
documentation should be available for APHIS inspection. 
 
To be corrected by: End of Business 23-December-2023 
 
A complete routine inspection was conducted on 21-December-2023. This inspection report is limited to the Direct non-
compliances identified during that inspection. An additional inspection report will be delivered with the other non-
compliances identified during this inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
